# rindexer

> High-performance EVM blockchain indexing tool built in Rust. A no-code or framework solution to build blazing fast EVM indexers with instant GraphQL APIs.

## Overview

rindexer is an open-source, high-speed indexing toolset developed in Rust, designed for compatibility with any EVM chain. It allows you to index blockchain events using a simple YAML file with no coding required, or use the Rust framework for advanced customization.

## Key Features

- **No-Code Configuration**: Define indexing logic with YAML
- **Built in Rust**: Maximum performance and reliability
- **Any EVM Chain**: Ethereum, Polygon, Arbitrum, Optimism, Base, and more
- **Instant GraphQL API**: Auto-generated API for indexed data
- **Real-time Streaming**: Kafka, Redis, RabbitMQ, AWS SNS/SQS, webhooks
- **Flexible Storage**: PostgreSQL, ClickHouse, CSV
- **Notifications**: Telegram, Discord, Slack integrations

## Installation

```bash
curl -L https://rindexer.xyz/install.sh | bash
```

## Documentation

- [Installation Guide](https://rindexer.xyz/docs/introduction/installation)
- [Quick Start - No Code](https://rindexer.xyz/docs/start-building/no-code)
- [Quick Start - Rust Framework](https://rindexer.xyz/docs/start-building/project)
- [YAML Configuration Reference](https://rindexer.xyz/docs/references/yaml-config)
- [CLI Commands Reference](https://rindexer.xyz/docs/references/cli-commands)
- [GraphQL API Reference](https://rindexer.xyz/docs/references/graphql)

## Quick Start

1. Install: `curl -L https://rindexer.xyz/install.sh | bash`
2. Create project: `rindexer new my-indexer --type no-code`
3. Start indexing: `rindexer start all`

## Deployment

- [Railway Deployment](https://rindexer.xyz/docs/deploying/railway)
- [AWS Deployment](https://rindexer.xyz/docs/deploying/aws)
- [GCP Deployment](https://rindexer.xyz/docs/deploying/gcp)
- [Docker Deployment](https://rindexer.xyz/docs/deploying/docker)

## Use Cases

- Hackathons: Quick indexer setup with GraphQL API
- Data Reporting: Build analytics dashboards
- dApp Development: Power applications with indexed data
- Enterprise: Production-grade indexing infrastructure
- Prototyping: Rapid idea validation
